info.name: Ticket booking service
info.description:
## Ticket booking service on NodeJS.
### This is submitted as an assignment for Zomentum in campus hiring.

**Submitted by Lakshya Khera (9917103014)**

item.name: Users

request.description:
This route retrieves all users documents in the collection.
This route uses caching middleware which caches the data in redis server.

This route is to add a single user document into the colelction and returns a user object with user id as well.

**Request Body**
```
user : {
    name: String, // Required
    phone : String, // Required
    email: String // Required
}
```

response.name: Fails if user name is not present.

request.description: Get single user document fetched using id in params, returns user document and throws error if provided id is invalid or user with the id doesn't exist.

response.name: Throws error if user is not present.

request.description: Deleted user document according to id provided in query, returns the deleted document and throws error if provided id is invalid or user with the id doesn't exist.

response.name: Throws error if user doesn't exist.

request.description: This route deletes all user in the collection and returns an object with deletedCount as property to display number of deleted user documents.

item.description:
User is the DB entity, who can book tickets and update timings.

The following routes describe the gateway routes for this entity.

item.name: Tickets

request.description: Fetches all tickets from the collection.

response.name: Get All Tickets

request.description: Adds ticket to the collection corresponding to particular movie slot by user, returns ticket document with populate movie and user document and throws error if user or movie slot doesn't exist or movie slot is full.

response.name: Throws error if movie slot doesn't exist
Throws error if ticket id doesn't exist

request.description: Deleted ticket corresponding to given ticket id and verifies if ticket id belongs to the provided user id, if yes it will return deleted ticket else throw error.

response.name: Throws error if ticket doesn't exist

request.description: Deletes all tickets and return object with deleteCount displaying number of deleted documents.

response.name: Throws error if ticket doesn't exist

request.description: This route, updates ticket timings, and returns new ticket and throws error if new slot doesn't exist or full, or other properties are invalid.

response.name: Throws error if ticket doesn't exist

request.description: Lets user to fetch tickets between given range.

response.name: Throws error if range is invalid or incomplete

item.description:
Tickets are entity booked by the user to book a seat for a particular movie slot.

The following routes describe the gateway routes for this entity.

item.name: Movies

request.description: This fetches all movies from the collections.

item.description: The following routes describe the gateway routes for this entity.

item.name: Movie schedule

request.description: Adds movie schedule if movie exists and set tickets booked to zero.

response.name: Throws error if movie doesn't exist.

request.description: Fetchs movie schedule document using provided id.
Delete movie slot if id is present and returns the document else error.
Deletes all movie slot and return object containing number of deleted documents.

item.description:
Movie schedule describes the time slot for the movie, it also holds the number of ticket books in the following slot.
The maximum value for tickets booked can be 20.

The following routes describe the gateway routes for this entity.

request.description: A health check route to make sure if the API is working or not.
